com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document

Class SpenObjectStroke

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenObjectBase
      • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenObjectStroke

  • public final class SpenObjectStroke
extends SpenObjectBase
    SpenObjectStroke class. This class represents a stroke object and provides methods for managing strokes.
    Since:
    3.0.0

    • Field Summary

      Stroke creation with a S-Pen.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addPoint(PointF pos, float pressure, int timestamp)
      Add the specified point, pressure and timestamp in the last position.
      If pressure or timestamp has not been set, pressure or timestamp will be ignored.
      If the tilt and orientation have been set, it should throw an exception.
      void addPoint(PointF pos, float pressure, int timestamp, float tilt, float orientation)
      Add the specified point, pressure, timestamp, tilt, and orientation in the last position.
      If pressure, timestamp, tilt or orientation has not been set, it will be ignored.
      void copy(SpenObjectBase source)
      Copy data from the specified object.

      Get the advanced pen settings.
      Use this method for getting pen advanced settings.

      Get the stroke color.
      float[] getOrientations()
      Get the pen orientations.
      The length of the orientations array is equal to the length of the points array.

      Get the pen tilts.
      The length of the tilts array is equal to the length of the points array.

      Get the stroke timestamps by microsecond.
      The length of the timestamps array is equal to the length of the points array.

      Set the specified stroke coordinate points.

      CAUTION : If you use setRect API with regionOnly is true and rect not cover all stroke's points, the canvas may not be updated correctly!

        Parameters:

        setPenName(String)

      • SpenObjectStroke

        public SpenObjectStroke(String penName,
                        PointF[] points,
                        float[] pressures,
                        int[] timestamps)
        Creates an SpenObjectStroke instance with the specified pen, stroke points, pressures, and time-stamps.
        For more details on penName, see setPenName(String). And, for more details on points, pressures, and timestamps, see setPoints(PointF[], float[], int[]).
        Parameters:
        penName - The name of the pen.
        points - The array of stroke points.
        pressures - The array of stroke pressures.
        timestamps - The array of stroke timestamps by microsecond. timestamps[0] should be 0 and others should be different with timestamp[0].
        But, if difference is over 65535 microsecond, it will be saved to 65535 microsecond.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if any element of points is null.
        Thrown if the lengths of points, pressures, timestamps are not equal.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if the array size is over 65535.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        setPenName(String), setPoints(PointF[], float[], int[])

      • SpenObjectStroke

        public SpenObjectStroke(String penName,
                        PointF[] points,
                        float[] pressures,
                        int[] timestamps,
                        boolean isTemplateObject)
        Creates an SpenObjectStroke instance with the specified pen, stroke points, pressures, timestamps and template status.
        For more details on penName, see setPenName(String). And, for more details on points, pressures, and timestamps, see setPoints(PointF[], float[], int[]).
        Parameters:
        penName - The name of the pen.
        points - The array of stroke points.
        pressures - The array of stroke pressures.
        timestamps - The array of stroke timestamps by microsecond. timestamps[0] should be 0 and others should be different with timestamp[0].
        But, if difference is over 65535 microsecond, it will be saved to 65535 microsecond.
        isTemplateObject - Set to true to create a template object, set to false to create a non-template object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if any element of points is null. Thrown if the lengths of points, pressures, timestamps are not equal.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if the array size is over 65535.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        setPenName(String), setPoints(PointF[], float[], int[])

      • SpenObjectStroke

        public SpenObjectStroke(String penName,
                        PointF[] points,
                        float[] pressures,
                        int[] timestamps,
                        float[] tilts,
                        float[] orientations)
        Creates an SpenObjectStroke instance with the specified pen, stroke points, pressures, time-stamps, pen tilts and pen orientations
        For more details on penName, see setPenName(String). And, for more details on points, pressures, timestamps, tilts, and orientations, see setPoints(PointF[], float[], int[], float[], float[]).
        Parameters:
        penName - The name of the pen.
        points - The array of stroke points.
        pressures - The array of stroke pressures.
        timestamps - The array of stroke timestamps by microsecond. timestamps[0] should be 0 and others should be different with timestamp[0].
        But, if difference is over 65535 microsecond, it will be saved to 65535 microsecond.
        tilts - The array of pen tilts.
        orientations - The array of pen orientations.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if any element of points is null. Thrown if the lengths of points, pressures, timestamps are not equal. Thrown if the array of tilts is NULL and the array of orientations is not NULL. Thrown if the array of tilts is not NULL and the array of orientations is NULL. Thrown if the arrays of tilts and orientations are not NULL and the lengths of points, tilts, orientations are not equal.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if the array size is over 65535.
        Since:
        3.1.0
        See Also:
        setPenName(String), setPoints(PointF[], float[], int[], float[], float[])

      • SpenObjectStroke

        public SpenObjectStroke(String penName,
                        PointF[] points,
                        float[] pressures,
                        int[] timestamps,
                        float[] tilts,
                        float[] orientations,
                        boolean isTemplateObject)
        Creates an SpenObjectStroke instance with the specified pen, stroke points, pressures, time-stamps, pen tilts, pen orientations and template status.
        For more details on penName, see setPenName(String). And, for more details on points, pressures, timestamps, tilts, and orientations, see setPoints(PointF[], float[], int[], float[], float[]).
        Parameters:
        penName - The name of the pen.
        points - The array of stroke points.
        pressures - The array of stroke pressures.
        timestamps - The array of stroke timestamps by microsecond. timestamps[0] should be 0 and others should be different with timestamp[0].
        But, if difference is over 65535 microsecond, it will be saved to 65535 microsecond.
        tilts - The array of pen tilts.
        orientations - The array of pen orientations.
        isTemplateObject - Set to true to create a template object, set to false to create a non-template object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if any element of points is null. Thrown if the lengths of points, pressures, timestamps are not equal. Thrown if the array of tilts is NULL and the array of orientations is not NULL. Thrown if the array of tilts is not NULL and the array of orientations is NULL. Thrown if the arrays of tilts and orientations are not NULL and the lengths of points, tilts, orientations are not equal.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if the array size is over 65535.
        Since:
        3.1.0
        See Also:
        setPenName(String), setPoints(PointF[], float[], int[], float[], float[])

    • Method Detail

      • setPenName

        public void setPenName(String penName)
        Set the specified name for the pen.
        penName is the pen ID for a stroke. If penName is not null and the default pen name is null, then the default pen name will be set as penName. When a SpenPageDoc undo or redo and the pen name is changed, if default pen name is null, then the default pen name will be set as the same as the pen name. If (@code penName} is not an old pen name (pen name that used from SDK 3.0 and before), the default pen name must be set an old pen name because of backward compatibility.
        Parameters:
        penName - The name for the pen.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        getPenName()

      • getPenName

        public String getPenName()
        Get the pen name.
        Returns:
        The name of the pen.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        setPenName(String)

      • setAdvancedPenSetting

        public void setAdvancedPenSetting(String penStyle)
        Set the advanced pen settings.
        Use this method for setting pen advanced settings. But, the preloaded pens don't have any advanced pen setting.
        Parameters:
        penStyle - The pen style.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        getAdvancedPenSetting()

      • getAdvancedPenSetting

        public String getAdvancedPenSetting()
        Get the advanced pen settings.
        Use this method for getting pen advanced settings. But, the preloaded pens don't have any advanced pen setting.
        Returns:
        The pen advanced settings.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        setAdvancedPenSetting(String)

      • setPoints

        public void setPoints(PointF[] points,
                      float[] pressures,
                      int[] timestamps)
        Set the specified stroke coordinate points.
        You can set null into element of pressures or element of timestamps to remove the information. But you can not set pressures and timestamps to null.

        CAUTION :
        Even if points are set, this method does not update the rectangle information of the region.
        Call the setRect(RectF,boolean) method for the region.
        Parameters:
        points - The array of stroke points.
        pressures - The array of stroke pressures.
        timestamps - The array of stroke timestamps by microsecond. timestamps[0] should be 0 and others should be different with timestamp[0].
        But, if difference is over 65535 microsecond, it will be saved to 65535 microsecond.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if any element of points is null. Thrown if the lengths of points, pressures, timestamps are not equal.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if the array size is over 65535.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        getPoints()

      • setPoints

        public void setPoints(PointF[] points,
                      float[] pressures,
                      int[] timestamps,
                      float[] tilts,
                      float[] orientations)
        Set the specified stroke coordinate points.
        You can not set pressures and timestamps to null.

        CAUTION :
        Even if points are set, this method does not update the rectangle information of the region.
        Call the setRect(RectF,boolean) method for the region.
        Parameters:
        points - The array of stroke points.
        pressures - The array of stroke pressures.
        timestamps - The array of stroke timestamps by microsecond. timestamps[0] should be 0 and others should be different with timestamp[0].
        But, if difference is over 65535 microsecond, it will be saved to 65535 microsecond.
        tilts - The array of pen tilts.
        orientations - The array of pen orientations.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if any element of points is null.
        Thrown if the lengths of points, pressures, timestamps are not equal.
        Thrown if the array of tilts is NULL and the array of orientations is not NULL.
        Thrown if the array of tilts is not NULL and the array of orientations is NULL.
        Thrown if the arrays of tilts and orientations are not NULL and the lengths of points, tilts, orientations are not equal.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if the array size is over 65535.
        Since:
        3.1.0
        See Also:
        getPoints()

        Get the stroke points.

        The array of stroke points.
        Since:

      • addPoint

        public void addPoint(PointF pos,
                     float pressure,
                     int timestamp)
        Add the specified point, pressure and timestamp in the last position.
        If pressure or timestamp has not been set, pressure or timestamp will be ignored.
        If the tilt and orientation have been set, it should throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        pos - The stroke point coordinates.
        pressure - The stroke pressure.
        timestamp - The timestamp by microsecond. It should be different with the timestamp of first point.
        But, if difference is over 65535 microsecond, it will be saved to 65535 microsecond.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the tilt and orientation have been set.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if the size of current points is 65535.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        setPoints(PointF[], float[], int[])

      • addPoint

        public void addPoint(PointF pos,
                     float pressure,
                     int timestamp,
                     float tilt,
                     float orientation)
        Add the specified point, pressure, timestamp, tilt, and orientation in the last position.
        If pressure, timestamp, tilt or orientation has not been set, it will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        pos - The stroke point coordinates.
        pressure - The stroke pressure.
        timestamp - The timestamp by microsecond. It should be different with the timestamp of first point.
        But, if difference is over 65535 microsecond, it will be saved to 65535 microsecond.
        tilt - The pen tilt.
        orientation - The pen orientation.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if tilt and orientation is not set until now.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if the size of current points is 65535.
        Since:
        3.1.0
        See Also:
        setPoints(PointF[], float[], int[], float[], float[])

      • setRect

        public void setRect(RectF rect,
                    boolean regionOnly)
        CAUTION : If you use setRect API with regionOnly is true and rect not cover all stroke's points, the canvas may not be updated correctly!
        Overrides:
        setRect in class SpenObjectBase
        Parameters:
        rect - The rectangle of region.
        regionOnly - Set to true to not allow the internal data to be changed, set to false to let rectangle change the internal data.
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • setCurveEnabled

        public void setCurveEnabled(boolean enable)
        Enable or disable curved lines.
        Parameters:
        enable - Set to true to enable curves, set to false to disable curves. The default property is true. If you set this to false, this stroke line is drawn as a straight line.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        isCurveEnabled()

      • isCurveEnabled

        public boolean isCurveEnabled()
        Check if curved lines are enabled for this instance.
        Returns:
        true, if curves are enabled.
        false, if curves are not enabled.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        setCurveEnabled(boolean)

      • setToolType

        public void setToolType(int toolType)
        Set the specified stroke tool type.
        Parameters:
        toolType - The stroke tool type.
        The valid values are:
        TOOL_TYPE_FINGER, TOOL_TYPE_SPEN, TOOL_TYPE_MOUSE, TOOL_TYPE_ERASER.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the toolType passed is invalid.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        TOOL_TYPE_FINGER, TOOL_TYPE_SPEN, TOOL_TYPE_MOUSE, TOOL_TYPE_ERASER, getToolType()

      • getToolType

        public int getToolType()
        Get the stroke tool type.
        Returns:
        The stroke tool type.
        The valid values are:
        TOOL_TYPE_FINGER, TOOL_TYPE_SPEN, TOOL_TYPE_MOUSE, TOOL_TYPE_ERASER.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        TOOL_TYPE_FINGER, TOOL_TYPE_SPEN, TOOL_TYPE_MOUSE, TOOL_TYPE_ERASER, setToolType(int)
